verses.kjv: And it came to pass on the second sabbath after the first, that he went through the corn fields; and his disciples plucked the ears of corn, and did eat, rubbing them in their hands.
verses.web: Now on the second Sabbath after the first, he was going through the grain fields. His disciples plucked the heads of grain and ate, rubbing them in their hands.
verses.ct: One Sabbath, Jesus was walking through the grain fields, and his disciples were picking heads of grain, rubbing them in their hands, and eating them.

verses.kjv: And certain of the Pharisees said unto them, Why do ye that which is not lawful to do on the sabbath days?
verses.web: But some of the Pharisees said to them, “Why do you do that which is not lawful to do on the Sabbath day?”
verses.ct: Some of the Pharisees confronted them: "Why are you doing what's not allowed on the Sabbath?"

verses.kjv: And Jesus answering them said, Have ye not read so much as this, what David did, when himself was an hungred, and they which were with him;
verses.web: Jesus, answering them, said, “Haven’t you read what David did when he was hungry, he, and those who were with him;
verses.ct: Jesus answered them, "Haven't you even read what David did when he and his companions were hungry?

verses.kjv: How he went into the house of God, and did take and eat the shewbread, and gave also to them that were with him; which it is not lawful to eat but for the priests alone?
verses.web: how he entered into God’s house, and took and ate the show bread, and gave also to those who were with him, which is not lawful to eat except for the priests alone?”
verses.ct: He went into God's house, took the sacred bread that only priests are allowed to eat, and shared it with the men who were with him."

verses.kjv: And he said unto them, That the Son of man is Lord also of the sabbath.
verses.web: He said to them, “The Son of Man is lord of the Sabbath.”
verses.ct: Then he told them, "The Son of Man is Lord of the Sabbath."

verses.kjv: And it came to pass also on another sabbath, that he entered into the synagogue and taught: and there was a man whose right hand was withered.
verses.web: It also happened on another Sabbath that he entered into the synagogue and taught. There was a man there, and his right hand was withered.
verses.ct: On another Sabbath, Jesus went into the synagogue and began teaching. A man was there whose right hand was shriveled up.

verses.kjv: And the scribes and Pharisees watched him, whether he would heal on the sabbath day; that they might find an accusation against him.
verses.web: The scribes and the Pharisees watched him, to see whether he would heal on the Sabbath, that they might find an accusation against him.
verses.ct: The scribes and Pharisees were watching Jesus closely, hoping he would heal on the Sabbath so they could bring charges against him.

verses.kjv: But he knew their thoughts, and said to the man which had the withered hand, Rise up, and stand forth in the midst. And he arose and stood forth.
verses.web: But he knew their thoughts; and he said to the man who had the withered hand, “Rise up, and stand in the middle.” He arose and stood.
verses.ct: But Jesus knew exactly what they were thinking. He said to the man with the shriveled hand, "Get up and stand here in front of everyone." The man stood up and came forward.

verses.kjv: Then said Jesus unto them, I will ask you one thing; Is it lawful on the sabbath days to do good, or to do evil? to save life, or to destroy it?
verses.web: Then Jesus said to them, “I will ask you something: Is it lawful on the Sabbath to do good, or to do harm? To save a life, or to kill?”
verses.ct: Then Jesus said to them, "Let me ask you something: Is it lawful on the Sabbath to do good or to do harm? To save a life or to destroy one?"

verses.kjv: And looking round about upon them all, he said unto the man, Stretch forth thy hand. And he did so: and his hand was restored whole as the other.
verses.web: He looked around at them all, and said to the man, “Stretch out your hand.” He did, and his hand was restored as sound as the other.
verses.ct: He looked around at all of them, then said to the man, "Stretch out your hand." He did, and his hand was completely restored — as healthy as the other one.

verses.kjv: And they were filled with madness; and communed one with another what they might do to Jesus.
verses.web: But they were filled with rage, and talked with one another about what they might do to Jesus.
verses.ct: But the Pharisees and scribes were furious, and they began discussing with each other what they could do to Jesus.

verses.kjv: And it came to pass in those days, that he went out into a mountain to pray, and continued all night in prayer to God.
verses.web: In these days, he went out to the mountain to pray, and he continued all night in prayer to God.
verses.ct: Around that time, Jesus went up on a mountain to pray, and he spent the entire night in prayer to God.

verses.kjv: And when it was day, he called unto him his disciples: and of them he chose twelve, whom also he named apostles;
verses.web: When it was day, he called his disciples, and from them he chose twelve, whom he also named apostles:
verses.ct: When morning came, he called his disciples together and chose 12 of them, whom he named apostles:

verses.kjv: Simon, (whom he also named Peter,) and Andrew his brother, James and John, Philip and Bartholomew,
verses.web: Simon, whom he also named Peter; Andrew, his brother; James; John; Philip; Bartholomew;
verses.ct: Simon, whom he also named Peter; Andrew, Peter's brother; James; John; Philip; Bartholomew;

verses.kjv: Matthew and Thomas, James the son of Alphaeus, and Simon called Zelotes,
verses.web: Matthew; Thomas; James, the son of Alphaeus; Simon, who was called the Zealot;
verses.ct: Matthew; Thomas; James son of Alphaeus; Simon, known as the Zealot;

verses.kjv: And Judas the brother of James, and Judas Iscariot, which also was the traitor.
verses.web: Judas the son of James; and Judas Iscariot, who also became a traitor.
verses.ct: Judas son of James; and Judas Iscariot, who would later betray him.

verses.kjv: And he came down with them, and stood in the plain, and the company of his disciples, and a great multitude of people out of all Judaea and Jerusalem, and from the sea coast of Tyre and Sidon, which came to hear him, and to be healed of their diseases;
verses.web: He came down with them, and stood on a level place, with a crowd of his disciples, and a great number of the people from all Judea and Jerusalem, and the sea coast of Tyre and Sidon, who came to hear him and to be healed of their diseases;
verses.ct: Jesus came down the mountain with them and stood on a level area. A large crowd of his disciples was there, along with a huge number of people from all over Judaea, Jerusalem, and the coastal region of Tyre and Sidon. They had come to hear him and to be healed of their diseases.

verses.kjv: And they that were vexed with unclean spirits: and they were healed.
verses.web: as well as those who were troubled by unclean spirits, and they were being healed.
verses.ct: Those tormented by unclean spirits were also healed.

verses.kjv: And the whole multitude sought to touch him: for there went virtue out of him, and healed them all.
verses.web: All the multitude sought to touch him, for power came out of him and healed them all.
verses.ct: The entire crowd was trying to touch him, because power was flowing out of him and healing everyone.

verses.kjv: And he lifted up his eyes on his disciples, and said, Blessed be ye poor: for yours is the kingdom of God.
verses.web: He lifted up his eyes to his disciples, and said, “Blessed are you who are poor, God’s Kingdom is yours.
verses.ct: Jesus looked up at his disciples and said, "Blessed are you who are poor, because the kingdom of God belongs to you.

verses.kjv: Blessed are ye that hunger now: for ye shall be filled. Blessed are ye that weep now: for ye shall laugh.
verses.web: Blessed are you who hunger now, for you will be filled. Blessed are you who weep now, for you will laugh.
verses.ct: Blessed are you who are hungry now, because you will be satisfied. Blessed are you who weep now, because you will laugh.

verses.kjv: Blessed are ye, when men shall hate you, and when they shall separate you from their company, and shall reproach you, and cast out your name as evil, for the Son of man’s sake.
verses.web: Blessed are you when men hate you, and when they exclude and mock you, and throw out your name as evil, for the Son of Man’s sake.
verses.ct: Blessed are you when people hate you, shut you out, insult you, and reject your name as evil — all because of the Son of Man.

verses.kjv: Rejoice ye in that day, and leap for joy: for, behold, your reward is great in heaven: for in the like manner did their fathers unto the prophets.
verses.web: Rejoice in that day, and leap for joy, for behold, your reward is great in heaven, for their fathers did the same thing to the prophets.
verses.ct: When that happens, rejoice! Jump for joy! Your reward in heaven is great. After all, their ancestors treated the prophets the same way.

verses.kjv: But woe unto you that are rich! for ye have received your consolation.
verses.web: “But woe to you who are rich! For you have received your consolation.
verses.ct: But how terrible it will be for you who are rich, because you've already received all the comfort you're going to get.

verses.kjv: Woe unto you that are full! for ye shall hunger. Woe unto you that laugh now! for ye shall mourn and weep.
verses.web: Woe to you, you who are full now, for you will be hungry. Woe to you who laugh now, for you will mourn and weep.
verses.ct: How terrible for you who are well-fed now, because you will go hungry. How terrible for you who laugh now, because you will mourn and weep.

verses.kjv: Woe unto you, when all men shall speak well of you! for so did their fathers to the false prophets.
verses.web: Woe, when men speak well of you, for their fathers did the same thing to the false prophets.
verses.ct: How terrible for you when everyone speaks well of you, because that's exactly how their ancestors treated the false prophets.

verses.kjv: But I say unto you which hear, Love your enemies, do good to them which hate you,
verses.web: “But I tell you who hear: love your enemies, do good to those who hate you,
verses.ct: But to those of you who are listening, I say this: Love your enemies. Do good to those who hate you.

verses.kjv: Bless them that curse you, and pray for them which despitefully use you.
verses.web: bless those who curse you, and pray for those who mistreat you.
verses.ct: Bless those who curse you. Pray for those who mistreat you.

verses.kjv: And unto him that smiteth thee on the one cheek offer also the other; and him that taketh away thy cloak forbid not to take thy coat also.
verses.web: To him who strikes you on the cheek, offer also the other; and from him who takes away your cloak, don’t withhold your coat also.
verses.ct: If someone strikes you on one cheek, offer the other one too. If someone takes your cloak, don't stop them from taking your coat as well.

verses.kjv: Give to every man that asketh of thee; and of him that taketh away thy goods ask them not again.
verses.web: Give to everyone who asks you, and don’t ask him who takes away your goods to give them back again.
verses.ct: Give to everyone who asks you, and if someone takes what belongs to you, don't demand it back.

verses.kjv: And as ye would that men should do to you, do ye also to them likewise.
verses.web: “As you would like people to do to you, do exactly so to them.
verses.ct: Treat others the way you want them to treat you.

verses.kjv: For if ye love them which love you, what thank have ye? for sinners also love those that love them.
verses.web: If you love those who love you, what credit is that to you? For even sinners love those who love them.
verses.ct: If you only love people who love you back, what credit is that to you? Even sinners love those who love them.

verses.kjv: And if ye do good to them which do good to you, what thank have ye? for sinners also do even the same.
verses.web: If you do good to those who do good to you, what credit is that to you? For even sinners do the same.
verses.ct: If you only do good to people who do good to you, what credit is that to you? Even sinners do that much.

verses.kjv: And if ye lend to them of whom ye hope to receive, what thank have ye? for sinners also lend to sinners, to receive as much again.
verses.web: If you lend to those from whom you hope to receive, what credit is that to you? Even sinners lend to sinners, to receive back as much.
verses.ct: If you only lend to people you expect to pay you back, what credit is that to you? Even sinners lend to sinners, expecting to be repaid in full.

verses.kjv: But love ye your enemies, and do good, and lend, hoping for nothing again; and your reward shall be great, and ye shall be the children of the Highest: for he is kind unto the unthankful and to the evil.
verses.web: But love your enemies, and do good, and lend, expecting nothing back; and your reward will be great, and you will be children of the Most High; for he is kind toward the unthankful and evil.
verses.ct: Instead, love your enemies, do good, and lend without expecting anything in return. Your reward will be great, and you will be children of the Most High, because he is kind even to the ungrateful and the evil.

verses.kjv: Be ye therefore merciful, as your Father also is merciful.
verses.web: “Therefore be merciful, even as your Father is also merciful.
verses.ct: Be merciful, just as your Father is merciful.

verses.kjv: Judge not, and ye shall not be judged: condemn not, and ye shall not be condemned: forgive, and ye shall be forgiven:
verses.web: Don’t judge, and you won’t be judged. Don’t condemn, and you won’t be condemned. Set free, and you will be set free.
verses.ct: Don't judge others, and you won't be judged. Don't condemn others, and you won't be condemned. Forgive, and you will be forgiven.

verses.kjv: Give, and it shall be given unto you; good measure, pressed down, and shaken together, and running over, shall men give into your bosom. For with the same measure that ye mete withal it shall be measured to you again.
verses.web: “Give, and it will be given to you: good measure, pressed down, shaken together, and running over, will be given to you. For with the same measure you measure it will be measured back to you.”
verses.ct: Give, and it will be given back to you — pressed down, shaken together, and overflowing. It will be poured right into your lap. Because whatever measure you use for others, that same measure will be used for you."

verses.kjv: And he spake a parable unto them, Can the blind lead the blind? shall they not both fall into the ditch?
verses.web: He spoke a parable to them. “Can the blind guide the blind? Won’t they both fall into a pit?
verses.ct: He also told them a parable: "Can a blind person lead another blind person? Won't they both fall into a pit?

verses.kjv: The disciple is not above his master: but every one that is perfect shall be as his master.
verses.web: A disciple is not above his teacher, but everyone when he is fully trained will be like his teacher.
verses.ct: A student isn't above his teacher, but everyone who is fully trained will become like his teacher.

verses.kjv: And why beholdest thou the mote that is in thy brother’s eye, but perceivest not the beam that is in thine own eye?
verses.web: Why do you see the speck of chaff that is in your brother’s eye, but don’t consider the beam that is in your own eye?
verses.ct: Why do you notice the tiny speck in your brother's eye but ignore the wooden beam in your own?

verses.kjv: Either how canst thou say to thy brother, Brother, let me pull out the mote that is in thine eye, when thou thyself beholdest not the beam that is in thine own eye? Thou hypocrite, cast out first the beam out of thine own eye, and then shalt thou see clearly to pull out the mote that is in thy brother’s eye.
verses.web: Or how can you tell your brother, ‘Brother, let me remove the speck of chaff that is in your eye,’ when you yourself don’t see the beam that is in your own eye? You hypocrite! First remove the beam from your own eye, and then you can see clearly to remove the speck of chaff that is in your brother’s eye.
verses.ct: How can you say to your brother, 'Brother, let me get that speck out of your eye,' when you can't even see the beam in your own eye? You hypocrite! First remove the beam from your own eye, and then you'll be able to see clearly to remove the speck from your brother's eye.

verses.kjv: For a good tree bringeth not forth corrupt fruit; neither doth a corrupt tree bring forth good fruit.
verses.web: For there is no good tree that produces rotten fruit; nor again a rotten tree that produces good fruit.
verses.ct: A good tree doesn't produce rotten fruit, and a rotten tree doesn't produce good fruit.

verses.kjv: For every tree is known by his own fruit. For of thorns men do not gather figs, nor of a bramble bush gather they grapes.
verses.web: For each tree is known by its own fruit. For people don’t gather figs from thorns, nor do they gather grapes from a bramble bush.
verses.ct: Every tree is identified by its own fruit. You don't pick figs from thornbushes, and you don't harvest grapes from a bramble bush.

verses.kjv: A good man out of the good treasure of his heart bringeth forth that which is good; and an evil man out of the evil treasure of his heart bringeth forth that which is evil: for of the abundance of the heart his mouth speaketh.
verses.web: The good man out of the good treasure of his heart brings out that which is good, and the evil man out of the evil treasure of his heart brings out that which is evil, for out of the abundance of the heart, his mouth speaks.
verses.ct: A good person produces good things from the goodness stored up in their heart, and an evil person produces evil things from the evil stored up in theirs. Whatever fills your heart is what your mouth will speak.

verses.kjv: And why call ye me, Lord, Lord, and do not the things which I say?
verses.web: “Why do you call me, ‘Lord, Lord,’ and don’t do the things which I say?
verses.ct: Why do you call me 'Lord, Lord,' but don't do what I say?

verses.kjv: Whosoever cometh to me, and heareth my sayings, and doeth them, I will shew you to whom he is like:
verses.web: Everyone who comes to me, and hears my words, and does them, I will show you who he is like.
verses.ct: Let me show you what it's like when someone comes to me, hears my words, and puts them into practice.

verses.kjv: He is like a man which built an house, and digged deep, and laid the foundation on a rock: and when the flood arose, the stream beat vehemently upon that house, and could not shake it: for it was founded upon a rock.
verses.web: He is like a man building a house, who dug and went deep, and laid a foundation on the rock. When a flood arose, the stream broke against that house, and could not shake it, because it was founded on the rock.
verses.ct: That person is like someone building a house who dug deep and laid the foundation on solid rock. When a flood came and the river slammed against that house, it couldn't be shaken, because it was built on rock.

verses.kjv: But he that heareth, and doeth not, is like a man that without a foundation built an house upon the earth; against which the stream did beat vehemently, and immediately it fell; and the ruin of that house was great.
verses.web: But he who hears, and doesn’t do, is like a man who built a house on the earth without a foundation, against which the stream broke, and immediately it fell, and the ruin of that house was great.”
verses.ct: But the person who hears my words and doesn't act on them is like someone who built a house on bare ground with no foundation. The moment the river hit it, the house collapsed, and the destruction was total."
